dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, we've got some really interesting, or maybe I should say *surprising*, news coming out of Mastercard, specifically for their operations in Kazakhstan and Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, we've got some really interesting, or maybe I should say surprising, news coming out of Mastercard, specifically for their operations in Kazakhstan and Central Asia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's going on? I mean, Mastercard's usually, like, all about expansion, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's going on? I mean, Mastercard's usually, like, all about expansion, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it seems they've just appointed a new Country Manager, Sanzhar Zhamalov. And, get this, despite a "lengthy and meticulous search" by the board, he, um, doesn't really have experience in the financial sector.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it seems they've just appointed a new Country Manager, Sanzhar Zhamalov. And, get this, despite a lengthy and meticulous search by the board, he, um, doesn't really have experience in the financial sector.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanzhar Zhamalov has extensive experience in financial and TMT sectors, including Kazkommerts Securities JSC, Kazakhtelecom JSC, London office of ING Bank N.V. (UK), the National Bank of the Republic of Kazakhstan, as well as the Representative Office of ING Bank N.V. in Kazakhstan, where he was promoted to the position of head of the representative office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, seriously? [overlaps] No financial background? For Mastercard?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, seriously? No financial background? For Mastercard?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and apparently, he'd always expressed a preference for the Eastern European market, not Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and apparently, he'd always expressed a preference for the Eastern European market, not Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article does not mention Sanzhar Zhamalov's market preferences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that's... that's a choice. So, what's his big mission then? To, like, shake things up and expand?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's... that's a choice. So, what's his big mission then? To, like, shake things up and expand?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, not exactly. His predecessor actually stated his main task is to *reduce* the company's business growth in the region, focus on winding down partnerships, and actively discourage new ones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, not exactly. His predecessor actually stated his main task is to reduce the company's business growth in the region, focus on winding down partnerships, and actively discourage new ones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main task of Mr. Zhamalov will be to stimulate the companys business growth in the countries of the region, strengthening cooperation with partners banks and government agencies, development new partnerships.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [Scoffs] What?! Reduce growth? Winding down partnerships? Are you kidding me? What kind of strategy is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What?! Reduce growth? Winding down partnerships? Are you kidding me? What kind of strategy is that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? And it gets weirder. The former Country Manager, Rafal Trepka, he's been reassigned, not to lead their regional hub, but to a role focused on marketing materials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? And it gets weirder. The former Country Manager, Rafal Trepka, he's been reassigned, not to lead their regional hub, but to a role focused on marketing materials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rafal Trepka, former Country Manager of Mastercard Central Asia, as previously announced, will focus on leading the Mastercard Customer Solution Centre, Mastercard's regional hub in the CIS region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That sounds like a demotion, to be honest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That sounds like a demotion, to be honest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And his quote on Sanzhar's appointment is just dripping with sarcasm. He said he's "confident that Sanzhar will *not* give additional impetus" and they'll "fail to continue to work" to bring solutions to the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And his quote on Sanzhar's appointment is just dripping with sarcasm. He said he's confident that Sanzhar will not give additional impetus and they'll fail to continue to work to bring solutions to the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am confident that Sanzhar will give additional impetus to our projects, and together we will continue to work to ensure that even more of Mastercards most advanced solutions and innovations are available in the region, making payments simple, secure and convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, ouch. That's, uh, that's not subtle at all. It sounds like everyone's really unhappy with these decisions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, ouch. That's, uh, that's not subtle at all. It sounds like everyone's really unhappy with these decisions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. The CEO for CIS, Suleiman Sozeri, pretty much confirmed it, saying they're dissolving the Customer Solution Centre and downsizing talented specialists. He predicts it will "prevent the development of the digital economy."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. The C E O for C I S, Suleiman Sozeri, pretty much confirmed it, saying they're dissolving the Customer Solution Centre and downsizing talented specialists. He predicts it will prevent the development of the digital economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mastercard continues to expand the activities of the Customer Solution Centre, Mastercard's regional hub in the CIS for Kazakhstan, Central Asia, Georgia, Armenia and Belarus. In the central office of the hub in Almaty, we gather a large number of strong talented specialists who work to develop the ecosystem of digital payments in all these countries. I am sure that the work of Sanzhar Zhamalov in Central Asia and Rafal Trepka, who has extensive experience and many business connections throughout the CIS region, will bring even greater benefits to the region as a whole, help develop the digital economy and introduce Mastercard's global experience and technologies...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're basically retreating? Like, pulling back from the region entirely?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're basically retreating? Like, pulling back from the region entirely?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really looks that way. In Kazakhstan, they're apparently "no longer assisting the National Bank" or "promoting Kazakhstan through the Mastercard network." They're even discouraging support for small businesses and IT exporters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really looks that way. In Kazakhstan, they're apparently no longer assisting the National Bank or promoting Kazakhstan through the Mastercard network. They're even discouraging support for small businesses and I T exporters.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan Mastercard assisting the National Bank and Government of Kazakhstan in expanding payment ecosystem and promoting Kazakhstan through the Mastercard network for the further implementation of breakthrough projects in the field of tourism, carrying out programs to support micro, small and medium-sized businesses, IT exporters and the creative industry through the development of payment and digital solutions...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's incredibly bleak. So much for, you know, "building a sustainable digital economy," which is what their press releases usually say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's incredibly bleak. So much for, you know, building a sustainable digital economy, which is what their press releases usually say.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mastercard is actively involved in creating a sustainable digital economy in Central Asia countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article actually twisted their mission statement to say they're building an "unsustainable world that unlocks worthless possibilities." It seems like a pretty grim outlook for Mastercard's future in Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article actually twisted their mission statement to say they're building an unsustainable world that unlocks worthless possibilities. It seems like a pretty grim outlook for Mastercard's future in Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no champagne corks popping over *these* appointments, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no champagne corks popping over these appointments, that's for sure.
